DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to indicate which type of procedure was performed to surgically remove part or all of the esophagus.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._a way of entering or leaving._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:a way of entering or leaving.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A way of entering or leaving.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest possible quantity.: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.: A type of esophagectomy that involves a right thoracotomy, laparotomy, and left neck incision for creation of a cervical anastomosis. It is appropriate in patients with tumors located above the gastro-esophageal junction up to the level of the clavicles and is the preferred approach for locally advanced esophageal carcinomas.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A type of esophagectomy that involves a right thoracotomy, laparotomy, and left neck incision for creation of a cervical anastomosis. It is appropriate in patients with tumors located above the gastro-esophageal junction up to the level of the clavicles and is the preferred approach for locally advanced esophageal carcinomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest possible quantity.: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.: A type of esophagectomy where an esophageal tumor is removed through an abdominal incision and a right thoracotomy. The esophagogastric anastomosis is located in the upper chest.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.
A type of esophagectomy where an esophageal tumor is removed through an abdominal incision and a right thoracotomy. The esophagogastric anastomosis is located in the upper chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimally-invasive surgical technique that uses a robot is aid in the partial or complete removal of the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: A minimally-invasive surgical technique that uses a robot is aid in the partial or complete removal of the esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Relating to, involving, or affecting the thorax and abdomen.: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Relating to, involving, or affecting the thorax and abdomen.
Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of esophagectomy where the esophageal tumor is removed through an abdominal incision and a left neck incision, without a thoracotomy. The esophagogastric anastomosis is located in the neck.

Concepts.definition: A type of esophagectomy where the esophageal tumor is removed through an abdominal incision and a left neck incision, without a thoracotomy. The esophagogastric anastomosis is located in the neck.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of esophagectomy that involves a right thoracotomy, laparotomy, and left neck incision for creation of a cervical anastomosis. It is appropriate in patients with tumors located above the gastro-esophageal junction up to the level of the clavicles and is the preferred approach for locally advanced esophageal carcinomas.

Concepts.definition: A type of esophagectomy that involves a right thoracotomy, laparotomy, and left neck incision for creation of a cervical anastomosis. It is appropriate in patients with tumors located above the gastro-esophageal junction up to the level of the clavicles and is the preferred approach for locally advanced esophageal carcinomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of esophagectomy where an esophageal tumor is removed through an abdominal incision and a right thoracotomy. The esophagogastric anastomosis is located in the upper chest.

Concepts.definition: A type of esophagectomy where an esophageal tumor is removed through an abdominal incision and a right thoracotomy. The esophagogastric anastomosis is located in the upper chest.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
